text: Beautiful restaurant, amazing food, very attentive staff…pricey but that’s what you get for a fine-dining experience. I highly recommend this restaurant for that special occasion.

Had a great Imperial High Tea with them.
Very professional and friendly staffs, all the items are delicious, very flavourful and not too salty.
Came for a kunfu tea experience. But I get this instead. $16.80 for the teapot on the right. Da Hong pao. And $9 for the teapot on the left. Why did I even bother.

They took the time to sit with me and explain the brewing process and some of the history and culture of tea. It was very generous and I really appreciated it all. They exceeded every hope I had when I came here to visit.

I wasn't sure what the famous restaurant was because I was taken there, but I ate some dim sum.
It was pretty good. A staff member who specializes in tea pours tea for customers using a long-tipped teapot (?I don't think so?). It seems like you can get a second helping as well. I'd like to say that it's an outstanding technique and doesn't spill a single drop, but you have to be careful as hot water sometimes splashes out (lol).
Because the prices are high... Maybe there are cheaper and better options in Chinatown?
